result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob L Crews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervison Fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
--------------------------------

No contact with co-defendants Jamaal Shellie, Matthew Brown, Ernest Green, Ashley Keller, Christina Lavender and Trisha Mohr. Maintain sobriety. No alcohol or illegal drugs.
--------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
--------------------------------

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
Concurrent with: Count #1

Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
--------------------------------

Defendant committed for thirty (30) days to Walworth County Jail, concurrent with Counts #1 & #2.
--------------------------------
**08/07/2015 CORRECTION:  As the Jail Sentence on Ct #3 is to run concurrent with the prison sentences on Counts #1 & #2, the JOC on Ct #3 has been corrected to reflect the same sentence credit.  
--------------------------------
Concurrent with: Counts #1 & #2

IT IS ORDERED THAT the petition for leave to appeal is denied without costs.
Competency Report

Defendant Jacob L Crews in court, in custody with attorney Melissa A Frost.  Haley J Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frost has concerns about the defendant's competency to proceed. IT IS ORDERED THAT the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee.  This order waives only the filing fees in the Court of Appeals.

Defendant Jacob L Crews in court, in custody with attorney Melissa A Frost.  Daniel A Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Motion to Dismiss is filed in court. Court denies Motion,  Arraignment scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

State moves Exhibit S-1 (Amended Criminal Complaint previously marked) into evidence. No objection. Court so orders. No cross exam. Witness excused @ 3:10 p.m. State has no other witnesses or evidence. Defense has no witnesses or evidence. Evidence closed @ 3:11 p.m.

Melissa Frost

Defendant Jacob L Crews in court, in custody with attorney Jacob B Frost.  Diane Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested within time period.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.

MUST POST $5,000.00 CASH. MUST BE CO-SIGNED BY MARK CREWS (FATHER).   Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons. NO CONTACT WITH JAMALL SHELLIE OR HIS RESIDENCE. NO CONTACT WITH CI #1049 IF KNOWN.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. Reference SO# 14-600 and 14-601.

Defendant appears in court, in custody, with attorney Travis Schwantes for bond purposes only. Haley Rea appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed. Motion to modify bond by attorney Schwantes is granted.
